definitions.definition: To die because of lack of food or of not eating.
To suffer severely because of lack of food or of not eating.

examples: I was starving so I wrote S.O.S. on the desert island using rocks.

definitions.definition: To kill or attempt to kill by depriving of food.
To make suffer severely by depriving of food.
To force a combatant to submit or surrender by depriving of food, as in a targeted siege.
examples: If they refuse to surrender the garrison, we'll just starve them out.

definitions.definition: To force a population center to submit or surrender by depriving of food, as in sieges in international armed conflicts.
examples: Some historians have since classified the Siege of Leningrad as a genocide due to the intentional destruction of the city and the systematic starvation of its civilian population.

definitions.definition: To deprive of nourishment or of some vital component.
examples: The uncaring parents starved the child of love.
'The patient's brain was starved of oxygen.

definitions.definition: To deteriorate for want of any essential thing.
To kill with cold ; to (cause to) die from cold .
examples: I was half starved waiting out in that wind.
definitions.label_groups: transitive , British , especially Yorkshire and Lancashire

definitions.definition: To die ; in later use especially to die slowly, waste away.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To die because of lack of food or of not eating.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To suffer severely because of lack of food or of not eating.
( transitive ) To kill or attempt to kill by depriving of food.
( transitive ) To make suffer severely by depriving of food.
( transitive ) To force a combatant to submit or surrender by depriving of food, as in a targeted siege.
( transitive , dated ) To force a population center to submit or surrender by depriving of food, as in sieges in international armed conflicts.
( transitive ) To deprive of nourishment or of some vital component.
( intransitive ) To deteriorate for want of any essential thing.
( transitive , British , especially Yorkshire and Lancashire ) To kill with cold ; to (cause to) die from cold .
( intransitive , obsolete ) To die ; in later use especially to die slowly, waste away.
